issue.body:
Fixes #6605

As described in https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/pull/6656#issuecomment-1500887367 the correct fix here was simply to default to `Some(false)` for the global config (instead of `None` which lead to the same behaviour but caused issues with `:toggle`) while continuing to default to `None` for the language config so that the fallback keeps working correctly.

body: This still seems to be a problem for me (I'm on latest `master`). Don't know if I'm missing something.

As shown in https://helix-editor.com/news/release-23-03-highlights , since v23.03
, the commands to toggle text wrapping from Helix, are:
```
:set soft-wrap.enable true
:set soft-wrap.enable false
```
Setting a default value in the config.toml seems to be mandatory:

```
[editor.soft-wrap]
enable = true
```

Same issue here, commit 2ec59f8ff6d43f5ac72e745ec614c26de192aedd. I could repro with markdown files, because of my `languages.toml`:
```toml
# (snip)
[[language]]
name = "markdown"
soft-wrap.enable = true
# (snip)
```

After commenting the relevant line, I can toggle it freely.

`editor.soft-wrap.enable` has no effect. Presence or absence of `.editorconfig` has no effect
